reviews.text: Very nice British looking clock tower in the area. It stands out as a structure since its surroundings tend to be less British-looking. Right behind it are food stalls, so you can stop by for a bite too.
Historic clock tower! Still working fine 👍!
Historically important for Ipoh and the repainted clock tower and buildings look great
It is one of the heritage spot in Ipoh town. Good to take photo there, and nearby there are food stalls. Sometimes you can hear the clock bell sounding.
Good place to look for a cheap food, beautiful place and Near with mosques..
One beautiful building! You should watch it at night too! It's splendid! If you ever come to Ipoh don't ever forget to visit this historical place.
It's beautiful from outside, especially when lit at night. The hall can be rented for private functions.
Historic landmark of ipoh. Hard to find parking here.
Nice colonial design.  Almost identical in Penang and Malacca.  Pristine white sturdy structure,  visible from far.

Iconic place.
From central Ipoh head south on Jalan Gopeng (Federal Route 1) towards Simpang Pulai. You will see the colourfully decorated temples on your left at the foot of a hill (Gunung Rapat). Access to the cave temples is via a slip road directly behind the Pomelo Stalls opposite Hillcity Hotel.
Dewan Bandaran Ipoh building was designed by colonial government architect A.B. Hubback, who also designed the Ipoh Railway Station along with many of the now historic buildings in Kuala Lumpur. Construction of Dewan Bandaran began in 1914, but due to interruption to material supply brought about by World War I, the building was only completed in 1916. The building has a rusticated façade which contributes to its elegance.
Always breezy. During evening there will be a lot of people came either playing football, jogging or just hanging aound

The Park at the north end of the town and is essentially a large field (Padang). To commemorate Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee in 1898 the local Chinese communitee raised funds to create the field. The Brit's made it a cricket field for whites wearing whites and during the Japansaese occupation each morning it was used for Japanese ceremonies of allegiance. Today it is just a park for all to use.
If you're looking for a place to bring your family & kids for recreation this is the place, you can have beautiful scenery here besides seeing people playing football. There is a jogging track also

Historical.....and looks calm as the wind blows. Watching people playing crickets under a hot sun. The Perak flag is waving proudly welcoming it's tourist to witness it's beautiful scenic historical town. Even though I'm not Perakian but I'm proud that I'm Malaysian.
Nice view.. Cool place

Nice hotel, decent spacious rooms with large bathrooms. Serves very good English breakfast with a few local Malaysian dishes. may custom prepare Vegetarian fried rice on request. Very polite and helping staff.

Didn't use any other facilities.

Linen needs to be replaced, towels look old and bedsheets have small holes.

Checking in was just a breeze. They allow us to enter room even though check in time is at 3.00 pm. Room is not small, not so big, just nice for a single room. Iron, ironing board, hair dryer, prayer mat, coffee/tea and toiletries are provided. New hotel do everything is quite new. Overall nice hotel

So... There have a hotel and apartment to, both of them have there own swimming pools. Ones can use each other property. And you will have a good view from your room window, View of the mountains or a busy yet relaxing of sight from town of IPOH.
Excellent hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable...as expected. Overall, the hotel exceeded my expectations in all aspects. Will certainly return to this hotel if ever I am in Ipoh again.

Nice clean hotel. Rates are reasonable and the amenities are good; with swimming pool, restaurant, bistro / cafe with live band. Would recommend this hotel for business travellers as well as families.

Great temple. Very beautiful and peaceful inside where there is the main temple. It's too bad you can't go inside. Also fun to feed the turtles and fish for the kids. Although the turtles don't look to have the best environment for how many there are.

Nice place that needs a bit of maintenance. Small place so you don't need much time here. The sign out the front says it closes at 3pm but we were politely told to leave at 2:10. Not even 5 min later, the lady running the place was on her push bike and on her way! 

I forgot what the opening time was so unfortunately cannot edit this listing.
A quiet and peaceful Chinese temple nestled within a limestone cave. Interesting items to see are the huge Chinese deity statues, tortoise and fish pond.
Scenic caves. Traditional buildings. Just avoid smokey areas where smokes from burning of paper properties, devices n money to the ancestors pervade the air.

Very beautiful place, you'll be greeted with beautiful ponds and interesting buildings after entering the gate but make sure you go into the cave. After being greeted with the statues, there's a passageway to the turtle pond. Don't skip this as you'll see the beautiful temple inside the cave!!

A side note, make sure you spray yourself with mosquito repellent!!
Om sakthi...amman

Truly an eye-opener for this. Although I have learn a lot of tin dredging and the tin mining industry when I was in school, this was the first time I had the opportunity to be up close and personal with a tin dredge. The guided tour of the facility really helped a lot as the indepth explanation by the guide will enable you to understand more about the tin mining industry.

There are hourly guided tours starting from 9.30 am up to 4.30 pm. Our guide, Ms. Hana was knowledgeable and able to provide general information about the place. Only ground floor is accessible at the moment while maintenance work are ongoing at certain parts. Loved the fact that my children were able to see for themselves what tin mining process looks like. Otherwise they can only imagine from their textbooks. Wish they would provide a vending machine for mineral water and recycle bins for general waste recycling like plastic bottles. Overall, this is a great effort by MB Inc. to restore our history for future generations.

You can only enter the dredge if you join the guided tour. It is about 40min long and quite informative. Ample parking and reasonably good facilities. Good to actually visit one of the last vestiges of the tin mining industry in Malaysia. It is commendable that they kept and maintained such a huge and impressive machine. The "lake" where the dredge floats on has hundreds or perhaps thousands of pretty fishes.

The one and only left tin dredge in Malaysia. There is guided tour with full information about tin dredge operation during its glory time. Entrance fee for mykad holder was rm10. Great education place.

Love this place. The tin dredging machine is, a sleeping giant now but she still maintains the poise and power she once was admired for.  Too bad the municipal council isn't fully utilizing the space.  I recommend that you buy tickets for the tours the day before. Artists,  painters,  photographers love to come in groups.  Very limited pay allowed in at each tour. Wear pants and long sleeve for your own protection.  Safety helmets provided for each tour.  Tickets at RM10/ pax.
Love coconut tarts.  Best!!
蛋撻中間不熟；蓮蓉蛋黃酥的餡料太乾；整體而言價錢非常貴，我們接受不到這個價錢的品質這麼讓人失望。

无意间吃到的龙须糖
龙须糖好吃又便宜

During our stay in Ipoh, this was our favorite spot to have breakfast. You can choose many types of food. 

The restaurant is always full, so there is a nice atmosphere. 

Price are very good. 

Ambra juice with sour plum is a must try. 

The white coffee is really rich and smooth as well !

Very famous food joint in Ipoh for both tourists and locals. You can get the typical Ipoh foods here. Quality is OK and acceptable. The problem is the restaurant is mostly packed causing a long waiting time. Worth to give it a try at least once, you can have an interesting stroll nearby in the old town.

Had a good popiah here; stall is operated by a very old lady who's probably in her 80s. This is a very busy kopitiam and you'll indirectly get hinted to leave as soon as you're done eating to make way for other customers. Overall a decent experience but was disappointed that the satay stall appeared to be not operating when I visited.

Very nice local 'coffee shop'. These are my favourite type of eateries in Ipoh and this one didn't disappoint. I only came in for a coffee and snack; thoroughly enjoyed it. A lovely iced coffee and custard, only 5rm. My friend also got the popiah but, as it's sweet, I'm not a fan. He said it's good. So, altogether, fully recommended.

The most renounce breakfast place in Ipoh for at least 60 years. All manned by local Chinese and you can get a taste of the past during the Ipoh's limetime as a tin mining town.

Here is famous for the chicken horfun (noodle soup), satay, popiah and the superb white coffee.

Calling Liang Tau Foo lovers
Absolutely one of the best i try
Laksa soup sweet sour slightly spicy unique taste but don't mistaken for Tom Yam
This Laksa over take Tom Yam
If you prefer clear soup, also have
It's definitely worth
For two person meal, it won't cost above 30 Rm unless you are like me
Eating 3 bowls 😁
Wide variety of famoud local food. Old style hawker stalls setting.

A big variety of “Yong tau fu”. Other stalls offering different types of food also available but people usually come here for the fish cakes .
Not bad, big pieces but would be much easier to handle if they were a bit smaller. Easier on the jaws...😂
Great reasonably priced Yong tau foo. Thought the roast pork was only soso

This place is highly recommended if you visit Ipoh and want to try out their yong tau fu. 

You can choose crackers, bitter gourd, green chilli stuffed with meat, fried yam bean (very very nice), brinjal and many many more. There are also noodle/bihun for you to choose aside from choosing if you want them to be served dry/wet with curry or normal soup.

Be sure to go to the right shop though as the shop next door sells almost the same food.
Yummy curry noodle and nice coffee. They have English menu, so it's easy to order for non-Chinese speakers.

Came on Friday morning. Store was not crowded but still quite difficult to get parking, guess was due to office hour.
The food was tasty especially the dry curry. Also had hor fun and toast bread with kaya butter... Nice too.
Will really recommend to friends who love curry and prefer a comfortable and clean environment to enjoy breakfast.
One interesting thing was that the shop kept having a TV ads showing Nicholas Tse 谢霆锋 came to eat in the shop. There's photo of him on the wall too.

Food is tasty,
Good customer service and very friendly
Very tasty and fantastic dry curry mee in Ipoh Old Town.
One of the few remaining food outlet on that side of old town.
Nice clean hawker centre. Good Curry mee
Nice and comfortable food court. Lots of varieties foods. But the time i was there  around 4pm few stalls already closed. Be early next time.
Alot of Chinese varieties. Does have 1 malay nasi lemak. Dessert good. Japanese cuisine is available as well

Favourite food court in Ipoh for high food quality and reasonable waiting time. Great duck egg char kuew teow, fantastic crunchy fresh popiah, lip-smacking curry noodles, sensational rojak, and punchy assam laksa. Drinks were reasonable except for the Thai coconut sold pricier than KL at Rm6 each.
Large variety of hawker food. Mostly ok or quite good.

The soy sauce of chicken and beansprout is a little bit over salty for us.
The chicken is good.
Rice so so.
Kuewtiao soup so so.
Lack of man power to take order.
Koptiam is normally crowded and noisy. But it was over noise to us.
Would choose this stall for the succulent steam chicken and the kai si hor fun noodles.Highly recommended to try!
Chicken tastes very good. Food is more towards the salty side but I like it, except the pork ball soup as it tastes weird

It's good
I came here because the one at Cowan street didn't open on that day
This shop is surrounded by alot of famous restaurant
The price isn't that cheap though
Rm10 for only chicken for 1 person..not yet include tauge and hor fun
Delicious cheap food. The noodle are to die for.

Delighted to see them actually put in effort to support the newly implemented no plastic policy.
I have got no problem with their new movement as I always got 2bags ready in my car.

Really delicious salt baked herbal chicken, available freshly cooked or vacuum packed. Best eaten fresh after purchasing from the store, that is when the chicken is cooked perfectly with tender meat and delicious juices. we usually go to the nearest coffee shop/soy milk store to eat the freshly cooked chicken. Taking it back home and eating it later, the chicken is not as juicy and the meat will not be as tender as the residual heat would have overcooked the chicken slightly. A must try in Ipoh!

There are too many salted chicken shops in Ipoh, believe most Ipoh salted chicken uses young free range chicken and it is juicy and delicious. Aun Kheng Lim is another shop we love.
The wrapped chicken can be kept frozen for at least a month. When you're ready to eat, unwrap the chicken and steam for five minutes with medium heat, alternatively you can reheat it in microwave oven after unwrapped.
Great taste! Nice herbal chicken, the chicken has been fully marinated, and it's aromatic.. Can really taste the herb fragrance for the whole chicken..

Finally got chance to try this famous Ayam Garam (Salt roasted chicken). It is not a restaurant so have to take away and eat it at hotel. The taste was excellent and the meat juicy. Good to go with a can of beer (or two!). It’s still good even not piping hot. Guess it would be even better when heated up. Nice!

For authentic dim sum on a early early day, Ming Court is definitely your top choice to come. I love it cause the taste most dishes here are great. Though I wished that it will be a little bigger while maintaining the price. If it is packed, you may need to wait a while and stand around to get your own seat. Don't expect to stand in line and get numbers. It doesn't work that way.

A lively crowded restaurant. You will end up sharing the large tables with other patrons if your party is less then 5. There's no menu, multiple servers will come to you with the selections they have on hand and you may pick to your heart's desire. While Asians might be used to experiences like this in a restaurant, westerners will either love it or hate it. The food's good though.

Love the dim sum & the variety here. The portions are smaller compared to those served in KL. Don’t really mind that cos they are yummy. However food do get cold fast. So don’t order too much in one go. Always packed with customers. And be prepared to share table.

Definitely one of the best Dim Sum that I ever had in Malaysia. Advisable to be early as it is the famous tourism spot in Ipoh. We arrived in group at 8am and it is full house that many are standing to wait for a seat.  However we are lucky enough to have the staff arrange a table for us. The service is so efficient that the dim sum been served to our table right after we got seated, and we just need to choose the one we like. The environment is quite old school without much fancy decoration but is clean and neat. In terms of food, there are various dim sum choices available and we are to full to try all, but those we ordered tasted awesome. Also, the price is affordable. Great experience in overall and highly recommended this dim sum place.

Quintessential Ipoh experience, dim sum breakfast from 6.30am. Recommended by local residents. Food was fresh, huge varieties and they come quickly! no waiting. There are two others dim sum restaurants in the same road. If you cannot decide, just go with Ming Court.
Those were the days I would say. Very limited curries and also drinks. Taste, average. Customer service, below average. Nothing much to say
Can never get enough of Samy. Not sure why some are complaining. The food taste the same as 12 years ago. Anyone looking for authentic Indian food, this is the place to go.
Brilliant! Best banana leaf I have had all year.... A must try! Great service and very reasonable price. Absolutely loved it! 😇

Thinking of taking a 25 minute drive out of Ipoh to Samy? You’re better off eating in Ipoh. 

While they do still have a large variety of meat options, the curries are ridiculously limited. Only chicken curry and sambar available! 

Taste wise: average. Just like any other Indian restaurant, nothing special. 

Price wise: More expensive than a standard Indian restaurant in KL

Samy has passed its heyday. Not worth the trip.
They dont't serve rawa thosai for breakfast, being an Indian restaurant it's a minus point but they have kulli paniyaram.
Food was alright but rather pricey. Better deals available around town.

I would make it a point to visit this restaurant each time I go to Ipoh. This is the place to be for delicious 大头虾. It only serves dinner if I am not mistaken. It’s quite pricy but it’s well worth the money. Try the fried noodle here as well. You won’t be disappointed.
Nice food and value
Food is good, place is very clean.
Great place for seafood

I love the loud & Hard Rock music when we came inside the restaurant. Waiters gave us a good service and smiling with handsome angle, hahaha. But i feel like still missing a things, the wall need more decoration? Love 🍕with pineapple forever. 😍

The pizzas were super delicious with chunks of meat and a generous amount of cheese on them. The brownies were amazing for dessert. We were also pleasantly greeted by the owner who was a nice gentleman. Kudos to the staff for good service. Merry Christmas!

Best homemade recipe pizza in Ipoh Town! The person who open this business is from America, which brings the feeling of a Chicago style Pizza from the environment in the restaurant, especially the music. There are many different choices of pizza you can order and even custom 2 kinds into one, example like half bacon and eggs and half pork and cheese. The price are slightly expensive then Domino and Pizzahat, but is worth it to me personally for a big size homemade pizza. I personally loves the Insane chocolate brownie in the menu, I will recommend to give it a try.
Great customer service and am happy the staff informed us that you can choose 2 flavours for the pizzas. Very good pizzas. Love the rootbeer float.
In terms of food, it taste delicious. In terms of service staff attitude and attention, need further improvement
Cosy place. The food and service very nice.
Reasonably priced Malaysian iconic dishes (nasi lemak, char kwetiauw, etc) in vegetarian way of cooking.

The food is not so great...alot of varieties but i doubt the taste.
The price is reasonable...so overall you can come here if you dont have any other options!
Food are delicious, price is reasonable, environment is comfortable.
vegetarian foods taste 👍
